links.title: Use Some More Proof Strategies

task: Recognize hypotheses and goals in a proof.
Apply modus ponens: \( A \rightarrow B,\, A \;\vdash\; B \)
Apply modus tollens: \( A \rightarrow B,\, (\neg B) \;\vdash\; (\neg A) \)
Apply transitivity: \( A \rightarrow B,\, B \rightarrow C \;\vdash\; A \rightarrow C \)
Apply disjunctive syllogism: \( A \vee B,\, \neg A \;\vdash\; B \)
Apply "addition": \( A \;\vdash\; A \vee B \)
Apply "simplification": \( (A \wedge B) \;\vdash\; A \)
Apply "conjunction": \( A,\, B \;\vdash\; (A \wedge B) \)
Apply "resolution": \( (A \vee B),\, (\neg A \vee C) \;\vdash\; (B \vee C) \)
links.title: Use Rules of Inference

task: Define the union of two or more sets.

Define the complement of a set.
Define the difference of two sets.
Define the symmetric difference of sets.
Draw Venn diagrams for 2, 3, 4 or 5 sets.

task: Explain proofs for 2 sets being different (conterexample).

Explain proofs using invariants
